desc:
Glance: This usually implies a deliberate but brief look. You choose to glance at something, even if only for a moment.
Glimpse: This suggests an unintentional or fleeting view. You might catch a glimpse of something out of the corner of your eye, or it might disappear before you get a good look.

1.I dare not mention the incident to him; he'll go crazy 
 2.I don't dare mention the incident to him; he'll go crazy
desc:
"Daren't" (I daren't mention the incident): This form is a contraction of "dare not." It is more commonly used in British English and can be considered somewhat formal. It is often seen in written language and may sound a bit old-fashioned.

"Don't dare" (I don't dare mention the incident): This is a more casual and widely used form in both British and American English. It is less formal and more commonly heard in spoken language
